alert.note: Alert for Hopkins; Hunt; Rains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 10:32PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hunt, Hopkins and Rains Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1031 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Cumby, or 13 miles southwest of Sulphur Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sulphur Springs, Emory, East Tawakoni, Point, Cumby, Como, Lake Sulphur Springs, Lake Tawakoni, Lake Fork Reservoir, Lone Oak, Martin Springs, Ridgeway, Flora, Flats, Hermits Cove, Dike and Weaver. This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 107 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
